name: Navbar features primary conversion goal
description: Check if the navbar includes the company's main conversion action (purchase, contact form, booking, etc.)
test_details:
Analyze the navigation bar to determine if it prominently features the company's primary conversion goal (e.g., 'Get Started', 'Book Now', 'Contact Us', 'Shop Now', etc.). The CTA should be clearly visible in the navbar.

Pass if a clear conversion-focused element exists in the navbar.
Fail if the navbar lacks any conversion-oriented CTA.

name: All important pages in navbar
description: Verify that key pages are accessible from the main navigation
test_details:
Check if all critical pages are present in the navbar (e.g., Products/Services, About, Contact, Blog, Pricing, etc.). The navigation should provide easy access to the most important sections of the website.

Pass if all expected important pages are accessible.
Fail if critical pages are missing or hard to find.

name: Clear visual hierarchy in menu
description: Check for visual hierarchy in navigation through styling differences
test_details:
Analyze the navigation menu for clear visual hierarchy using font size, weight, color, spacing, or other styling techniques. Important items should be emphasized, and there should be clear distinction between primary and secondary navigation elements.

Pass if there's obvious visual hierarchy (bolding, sizing, colors).
Fail if all menu items look identical with no hierarchy.

name: Sticky or accessible menu on scroll
description: Verify if the navigation remains accessible when scrolling
test_details:
Check if the navigation menu is sticky (fixed position on scroll) or if there's an easy way to access it while scrolling (e.g., back-to-top button, slide-in menu).

Pass if the menu stays visible or is easily accessible.
Fail if the menu disappears and requires scrolling back to top.

name: Seven or fewer top-level nav items
description: Check if the navigation follows the 7Â±2 rule to avoid overwhelming users
test_details:
Count the top-level navigation items (not including dropdown children). Following UX best practices, there should be 7 or fewer main navigation items to prevent cognitive overload.

Pass if 7 or fewer top-level items.
Fail if more than 7 top-level items.

name: Menus easy to interact with
description: Verify menus are usable on both desktop and mobile devices
test_details:
Analyze if menus are designed for easy interaction across devices. Check for touch-friendly sizes on mobile, clear hover states on desktop, and proper dropdown functionality.

Pass if menus appear well-designed for multi-device use.
Fail if menus have usability issues (too small, hard to tap, confusing).

name: Visual feedback for current page
description: Check if navigation shows which page is currently active
test_details:
Look for visual indicators (highlighting, underlining, different color, bold text) that show users which page they're currently on within the navigation menu.

Pass if there's clear active page indication.
Fail if no visual feedback for current location.

name: Visible search bar on every page
description: Check for search functionality accessibility, especially on mobile
test_details:
Verify if there's a clearly visible search bar or search icon on every page, with particular attention to mobile layout. Search should be easy to find without digging through menus.

Pass if search is clearly visible and accessible.
Fail if search is hidden or absent.

name: Breadcrumb links on sub pages
description: Check for breadcrumb navigation on deeper pages
test_details:
Look for breadcrumb navigation elements that show the page hierarchy and allow users to navigate up levels (e.g., Home > Products > Category > Item).

Pass if breadcrumbs are present on sub-pages.
Fail if no breadcrumb navigation exists.

name: Intuitive category pages or hubs
description: Verify clear category organization for products/services
test_details:
Check if the site has well-defined category pages or hubs that logically organize products/services. Categories should be intuitive and help users find what they need.

Pass if categories are clear and well-organized.
Fail if categories are confusing, poorly organized, or missing.

name: Filter and sort functionality
description: Check for filtering and sorting options on listing pages
test_details:
Look for filter and sort controls on product/service listing pages. Users should be able to narrow down options by relevant criteria (price, rating, category, etc.).

Pass if filtering/sorting exists where applicable.
Fail if no filtering options on pages that would benefit from them.
Not Applicable if the site doesn't have listings that need filtering.

name: Horizontal links between related categories
description: Check if related categories are connected with cross-links
test_details:
Analyze if related content or category pages have horizontal links connecting them (e.g., 'Related Services', 'You might also like', 'Similar Products'). This helps users discover related content.

Pass if horizontal navigation between related content exists.
Fail if pages are siloed without cross-links.

name: Clear URL hierarchy structure
description: Verify URL structure reflects logical site hierarchy
test_details:
Check if URLs follow a clear, hierarchical structure (e.g., /products/category/subcategory/item). URLs should be readable and reflect the site's information architecture.

Pass if URLs are well-structured and hierarchical.
Fail if URLs are flat, use random IDs, or don't reflect content hierarchy.

name: Content flows well with layout
description: Check if content is optimized for readability without walls of text
test_details:
Analyze if content is broken up appropriately with headings, images, white space, bullet points, and other formatting. Avoid long walls of text that are hard to scan.

Pass if content is well-formatted and scannable.
Fail if content appears as dense walls of text.

name: Customer-friendly language used
description: Check if content is written at an accessible reading level
test_details:
Analyze the page content to determine if it's written in clear, customer-friendly language (approximately 5th grade reading level). Avoid jargon, complex sentences, and overly technical language unless appropriate for the audience.

Pass if content is clear and accessible.
Fail if content is overly complex or hard to understand.

name: Logo links to homepage
description: Verify clicking the site logo returns users to the homepage
test_details:
Check if the site logo in the header is linked to the homepage. This is a web convention that users expect.

Pass if logo links to homepage.
Fail if logo is not clickable or doesn't go to homepage.

name: Brand clarity from hero content
description: Check if users can quickly understand what the brand sells
test_details:
Analyze the hero section and above-the-fold content to determine if users can immediately understand what the brand offers. The value proposition should be crystal clear.

Pass if the offering is immediately clear.
Fail if it's confusing or unclear what the brand sells.

name: Above-fold contains key elements
description: Check for essential conversion elements above the fold
test_details:
Verify that the above-the-fold view includes: compelling headline, relevant image/video, clear CTA, primary USPs, social proof elements, and any guarantees. These elements are critical for conversions.

Pass if most key elements are present.
Fail if multiple critical elements are missing.

name: Clear conversion path with minimal friction
description: Verify users can convert in 4 clicks or less
test_details:
Analyze if the path from landing to conversion is clear and requires minimal clicks (ideally 4 or fewer). The conversion funnel should be straightforward without unnecessary steps.

Pass if conversion path is clear and short.
Fail if conversion requires many steps or is confusing.

name: Forms are simple and minimal
description: Check if forms request only essential information
test_details:
Evaluate any forms on the page for simplicity. Forms should ask only for necessary information and be easy to complete. Long forms decrease conversion rates.

Pass if forms are concise and user-friendly.
Fail if forms are lengthy or request unnecessary information.

name: Multiple payment options available
description: Check for variety of payment methods at checkout
test_details:
Look for evidence of multiple payment options (credit cards, PayPal, Apple Pay, etc.). More payment options typically increase conversion rates.

Pass if multiple payment methods are mentioned.
Fail if only one payment method appears available.
Not Applicable for non-ecommerce sites.

name: One page checkout
description: Verify if checkout uses a single-page design
test_details:
Check if the checkout process uses a one-page design rather than multi-step process. Single-page checkout generally reduces cart abandonment.

Pass if checkout appears to be one page.
Fail if checkout is multi-step.
Not Applicable for non-ecommerce sites.

name: Free shipping offered
description: Check if the site offers free shipping
test_details:
Look for mentions of free shipping, which is a major conversion driver for ecommerce. Check headers, banners, and product pages.

Pass if free shipping is mentioned.
Fail if no free shipping or not mentioned.
Not Applicable for non-ecommerce sites.

name: Discounts or promotions available
description: Check if site offers any promotions or discount codes
test_details:
Look for promotional banners, discount codes, or special offers displayed on the site. Promotions can significantly boost conversions.

Pass if promotions or discounts are visible.
Fail if no promotional elements found.

name: Exit-intent popups present
description: Check for exit-intent popup functionality
test_details:
Look for evidence of exit-intent popup scripts or references in the page code. Exit-intent popups can recover abandoning visitors.

Pass if exit-intent functionality detected.
Fail if no exit-intent popups found.

name: Upsell opportunities present
description: Check if the site offers product upsells or cross-sells
test_details:
Look for upsell or cross-sell opportunities ('Customers also bought', 'Upgrade to premium', 'Add to your order', etc.).

Pass if upsell elements are present.
Fail if no upselling detected.
Not Applicable for non-ecommerce sites.

name: Customer reviews and testimonials featured
description: Check for presence of customer reviews or testimonials
test_details:
Look for customer reviews, testimonials, ratings, or social proof elements on the page. These build trust and increase conversions.

Pass if reviews/testimonials are present.
Fail if no social proof elements found.

name: FAQs implemented
description: Check for FAQ section or accordion
test_details:
Look for Frequently Asked Questions sections, ideally in a collapsible/accordion format. FAQs address objections and reduce support burden.

Pass if FAQ section exists.
Fail if no FAQ content found.

name: CTAs stand out and appear frequently
description: Check if call-to-action buttons are prominent and consistent
test_details:
Analyze if CTAs are visually distinct, appear multiple times on key pages, and use consistent styling. CTAs should stand out and guide users toward conversion.

Pass if CTAs are prominent and consistent.
Fail if CTAs are inconsistent, hard to find, or poorly designed.

name: Key pages include USPs
description: Verify Unique Selling Propositions are present on important pages
test_details:
Check if key pages (homepage, product/service pages, pricing) clearly communicate the brand's unique selling propositions and value differentiators.

Pass if USPs are clearly stated on key pages.
Fail if USPs are missing or unclear.

name: Key policy pages exist
description: Check for important policy and legal pages
test_details:
Verify that essential policy pages exist and are linked (Privacy Policy, Terms of Service, Return Policy, Shipping Policy where applicable). These build trust and legal compliance.

Pass if key policy pages are linked.
Fail if important policy pages are missing.

name: Guarantees featured on site
description: Check for money-back guarantees or satisfaction promises
test_details:
Look for guarantees (money-back, satisfaction, warranty, etc.) that reduce purchase risk and increase confidence.

Pass if guarantees are mentioned.
Fail if no guarantees found.

name: Site makes good first impression
description: Evaluate overall visual appeal and professionalism
test_details:
Analyze the overall visual design to determine if the site makes a positive first impression. Consider modern design trends, visual appeal, and professional appearance.

Pass if the site appears professional and appealing.
Fail if the design looks outdated, unprofessional, or poorly executed.

name: Design reflects brand identity
description: Check if visual design communicates unique brand personality
test_details:
Evaluate whether the visual design (colors, fonts, imagery, layout) reflects a unique brand identity rather than generic templates.

Pass if design feels branded and unique.
Fail if design appears generic or template-based.

name: Visually consistent design
description: Check for consistency in spacing, colors, buttons, and headings
test_details:
Analyze the page for visual consistency across elements. Spacing, alignment, colors, button styles, and heading styles should be consistent throughout.

Pass if design is highly consistent.
Fail if there are noticeable inconsistencies in design elements.

name: Avoids outdated design elements
description: Check if site uses modern design patterns and avoids dated trends
test_details:
Evaluate if the site avoids outdated design elements (excessive gradients, drop shadows, beveled edges, outdated fonts, flash-era designs, etc.).

Pass if design feels modern and current.
Fail if design uses outdated visual trends.

name: Uses high quality relevant images
description: Check for custom, relevant imagery rather than generic stock photos
test_details:
Analyze if the site uses high-quality, relevant images. Look for signs of generic stock photography versus custom, brand-specific imagery.

Pass if images appear custom and high-quality.
Fail if images are obviously generic stock photos or low quality.

name: Fonts are readable across devices
description: Check if typography is legible on all screen sizes
test_details:
Evaluate font choices and sizes for readability. Fonts should be large enough, have sufficient contrast, and be legible across device types.

Pass if fonts are clear and readable.
Fail if text is too small, low contrast, or hard to read.

name: Mobile responsive design
description: Verify site is properly responsive and mobile-friendly
test_details:
Check for mobile-responsive design indicators (viewport meta tag, responsive breakpoints, mobile-friendly layout). The site should work well on all screen sizes.

Pass if site appears mobile-responsive.
Fail if site lacks mobile optimization.

name: Buttons are mobile-friendly
description: Check if buttons are large enough for touch interaction
test_details:
Verify that buttons and interactive elements are sized appropriately for mobile touch targets (minimum 44x44px recommended).

Pass if buttons appear appropriately sized.
Fail if buttons seem too small for touch interaction.

name: Primary CTA above the fold
description: Check if each key page has a CTA in the initial viewport
test_details:
Verify that important pages (homepage, product pages, landing pages) include at least one primary call-to-action button above the fold.

Pass if CTA is present above the fold.
Fail if users must scroll to find the primary CTA.

name: Guest checkout enabled
description: Check if users can checkout without creating an account
test_details:
Look for evidence of guest checkout functionality. Forced account creation is a major conversion barrier.

Pass if guest checkout appears available.
Fail if account creation seems required.
Not Applicable for non-ecommerce sites.

name: Dedicated testimonials page
description: Check for a dedicated page showcasing customer testimonials
test_details:
Look for a dedicated testimonials, reviews, or customer success page that consolidates social proof.

Pass if a testimonials page exists.
Fail if no dedicated testimonials page.

name: Reviews visible on key pages
description: Check if reviews and star ratings appear on important pages
test_details:
Verify that product reviews and star ratings are displayed on key pages beyond just product detail pages (category pages, homepage, etc.).

Pass if reviews appear on multiple page types.
Fail if reviews are missing from key pages.

name: Reviews are legitimate and detailed
description: Check if reviews include names, dates, and specific details
test_details:
Evaluate if on-site reviews appear legitimate with reviewer names, dates, specific product details, and genuine feedback.

Pass if reviews appear authentic and detailed.
Fail if reviews seem generic or lack credibility indicators.

name: Customer photos or videos in reviews
description: Check for user-generated content in review sections
test_details:
Look for customer-submitted photos or videos within product reviews. User-generated content significantly increases trust.

Pass if customer photos/videos are present.
Fail if no user-generated content in reviews.
Not Applicable if no review system exists.

name: Review filtering and sorting
description: Check for options to filter or sort customer reviews
test_details:
Look for functionality to filter or sort reviews (by rating, date, verified purchase, etc.). This helps users find relevant reviews.

Pass if filtering/sorting options exist.
Fail if no review filtering functionality.
Not Applicable if no review system.

name: Third-party trust badges visible
description: Check for industry certifications and trust badges
test_details:
Look for third-party trust signals like BBB accreditation, industry awards, security badges, or certification logos that build credibility.

Pass if trust badges are present.
Fail if no third-party trust indicators.

name: Review stars in search results
description: Check if structured data enables review snippets in SERPs
test_details:
Look for structured data (schema.org) markup that would enable review stars to appear in search engine results pages.

Pass if review structured data is present.
Fail if no review schema markup found.

name: Price clearly visible
description: Check if pricing is prominently displayed on product/service pages
test_details:
Verify that prices are clearly visible on product or service pages. Hidden pricing creates friction and reduces conversions.

Pass if prices are clearly displayed.
Fail if prices are hidden or hard to find.

name: Clear value messaging for price
description: Check if pricing is justified with value communication
test_details:
Evaluate if the site communicates value to justify the price point. Look for benefit statements, comparisons, or value explanations near pricing.

Pass if value messaging supports the price.
Fail if price appears without value context.

name: Total cost visible before checkout
description: Check if users can see full costs including fees before checkout
test_details:
Verify that total costs (including taxes, shipping, fees) are visible before users reach the final checkout step. Hidden costs are a major cart abandonment cause.

Pass if cost breakdown is shown early.
Fail if costs only revealed at final step.
Not Applicable for non-ecommerce sites.

name: Bundle discounts clearly labeled
description: Check if bundle deals show clear price savings
test_details:
Look for bundle offers or multi-item promotions that clearly show the savings amount or percentage.

Pass if bundle savings are clear.
Fail if bundles don't show savings.
Not Applicable if no bundle offers.

name: Order total displayed before submission
description: Check if checkout shows final total before completing order
test_details:
Verify that the checkout displays the complete order total with all charges before the final 'Place Order' button.

Pass if total is clearly shown before submission.
Fail if total not visible until after order.
Not Applicable for non-ecommerce sites.

name: Discount code and amount displayed
description: Check if applied discounts are shown in order summary
test_details:
If discount codes are applied, verify that both the code and discount amount are displayed in the order summary.

Pass if discounts are clearly shown.
Fail if applied discounts not visible.
Not Applicable if no discount system or non-ecommerce.

name: Page Speed Insights score above 60
description: Check if pages score well on performance metrics
test_details:
Analyze performance data to estimate if the page would score above 60 on Google's PageSpeed Insights for both desktop and mobile. Look at load times, resource sizes, and performance indicators.

Pass if performance appears optimized (likely >60 PSI).
Fail if performance indicators suggest poor scores.

name: Core Web Vitals in good range
description: Check if URLs meet Core Web Vitals thresholds in Search Console
test_details:
Analyze performance metrics to estimate if the page meets Google's Core Web Vitals thresholds (LCP, FID, CLS).

Pass if performance suggests good Core Web Vitals.
Fail if metrics indicate poor Core Web Vitals.

name: Lazy loading implemented
description: Check if images, videos, and scripts use lazy loading
test_details:
Look for lazy loading attributes on images, iframes, and scripts (loading='lazy', intersection observer, etc.). Lazy loading improves initial page load performance.

Pass if lazy loading is implemented.
Fail if resources load eagerly without lazy loading.

name: Responsive images served
description: Check if images are optimized for different screen sizes
test_details:
Look for responsive image techniques (srcset, picture elements, appropriate sizing). Sites should serve appropriately-sized images for different devices.

Pass if responsive image techniques are used.
Fail if all images are served at full size.

name: Third-party scripts deferred
description: Check if external scripts are loaded asynchronously or deferred
test_details:
Analyze script tags for async or defer attributes. Third-party scripts should not block initial page rendering.

Pass if scripts use async/defer loading.
Fail if blocking scripts impact initial load.

name: No unnecessary bloat scripts
description: Check if site loads excessive or unnecessary third-party resources
test_details:
Analyze loaded scripts and assets for unnecessary bloat. Look for excessive tracking scripts, unused plugins, or redundant libraries that slow the site.

Pass if resource loading appears optimized.
Fail if many unnecessary scripts are detected.
